data.title: Treasure of Cortés
data.statement:
Hector Barbossa and the mutinous crew of the Black Pearl have landed on Isla de Muerta in search of the Treasure of Cortés! They follow a set of directions stolen from Jack Sparrow, unaware that Jack scribbled them down while drunk.

Jack wants to <<determine where the crew will actually end up by following these instructions>>, so that he can plan his next steps. Luckily, he has the actual map of the island on hand to help him.

data.constraints:
<<Input ranges>>:
• 1 ≤ [[steps]], [[W]], [[H]] ≤ 30
• 1 ≤ [[S]] ≤ 20
• [[W]] x [[H]] ≥ 2 (see Map constraints)

<<Map constraints>>:
• <<The landing spot {{O}} will always be at the top-left corner of the map - {{(0, 0)}}>>.
• There will be exactly one Treasure of Cortés {{X}}.

<<Instruction constraints>>:
• The instructions will never cause the crew to wander out of the island (map).
data.stubGenerator:
STATEMENT
------ North ------
-        ^        -
- West < o > East -
-        v        -
------ South ------

read W:int H:int
loop H read row:word(30)

read S:int
loop S read instruction:string(15)

write ... where will they end up?
Chase after them!
Find the real treasure!
They'll be back.
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: Two space-separated integers [[W]] and [[H]]; the width and height of the island map respectively.
<<Next [[H]] lines>>: A [[W]]-character string denoting a line of the island. Only these characters are used:
• {{O}} = landing spot (starting point)
• {{X}} = Treasure of Cortés (target)
• {{o}} = land
• {{x}} = fake treasure

<<Next line>>: An integer [[S]]; the number of instructions Jack wrote down.
<<Next [[S]] lines>>: A string in the format "[[steps]] {{step}}({{s}}) [[direction]]"; a single step of the instruction.
• [[direction]] is one of {{North}}, {{South}}, {{East}}, or {{West}}.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: The next course of action Jack should take.
• If the crew end up at the Treasure of Cortés ({{X}}): {{Chase after them!}}
• Else if the crew end up at some fake treasure ({{x}}): {{Find the real treasure!}}
• Otherwise: {{They'll be back.}}

Note: the crew must <<end up>> at the exact location after following <<all>> of Jack Sparrow's directions! Passing by the area does not count as finding the treasure.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Hector Barbossa and the mutinous crew of the Black Pearl have landed on Isla de Muerta in search of the Treasure of Cortés! They follow a set of directions stolen from Jack Sparrow, unaware that Jack scribbled them down while drunk.

Jack wants to determine where the crew will actually end up by following these instructions, so that he can plan his next steps. Luckily, he has the actual map of the island on hand to help him.
Input
Line 1: Two space-separated integers W and H; the width and height of the island map respectively.
Next H lines: A W-character string denoting a line of the island. Only these characters are used:
• O = landing spot (starting point)
• X = Treasure of Cortés (target)
• o = land
• x = fake treasure

Next line: An integer S; the number of instructions Jack wrote down.
Next S lines: A string in the format "steps step(s) direction"; a single step of the instruction.
• direction is one of North, South, East, or West.
Output
Line 1: The next course of action Jack should take.
• If the crew end up at the Treasure of Cortés (X): Chase after them!
• Else if the crew end up at some fake treasure (x): Find the real treasure!
• Otherwise: They'll be back.

Note: the crew must end up at the exact location after following all of Jack Sparrow's directions! Passing by the area does not count as finding the treasure.
Constraints
Input ranges:
• 1 ≤ steps, W, H ≤ 30
• 1 ≤ S ≤ 20
• W x H ≥ 2 (see Map constraints)

Map constraints:
• The landing spot O will always be at the top-left corner of the map - (0, 0).
• There will be exactly one Treasure of Cortés X.

Instruction constraints:
• The instructions will never cause the crew to wander out of the island (map).
Example
Input
3 2
Ooo
ooX
2
1 step South
2 steps East
Output
Chase after them!
